alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Marion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 2:20AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion and central Harrison Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 220 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Karnack to 7 miles southeast of Marshall to 6 miles east of Tatum. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Hallsville, Jefferson, Berea, Harleton, Woodlawn, Scottsville, Lassater, Nesbitt and Darco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
